applicability_reasoning: This regulation specifically governs advertisements and how regulated entities must handle comparisons and contrasts within advertisements. The document provided is a comprehensive pension scheme rules document that outlines the terms, conditions, definitions and operational aspects of a pension life cover scheme. It does not contain any advertisements or comparative marketing materials. The document is purely informational and contractual in nature, detailing the scheme's structure, benefits, trustee duties, and administrative procedures. While the document is from AIB life (a regulated entity), Regulation 87 regarding advertisement comparisons is not relevant to this type of legal/contractual documentation.
regulation_title: Comparisons and contrasts to meet certain standards
regulation_text: 87. (1) A regulated entity shall ensure that comparisons or contrasts in the information given in its advertisements are based either on facts verified by the regulated entity, or on reasonable assumptions stated within the advertisement concerned. (2) The comparisons or contrasts referred to in paragraph (1) shall be specified in a clear, fair and balanced way and not omit any key information from the comparison or contrast. (3) Differences in key information between products shall be specified clearly for the purposes of a comparison or contrast referred to in paragraph (1).
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
